paper_abstract: In this paper, we propose an efficient mobility management scheme in a two-level Hierarchical Mobile IPv6 (HMIPv6) architecture. A mobile node chooses a suitable Mobility Anchor Point (MAP) according to its average dwell time and its number of connecting correspondent nodes. Furthermore, a higher MAP may adjust the threshold of MAP selection algorithm periodically according to its traffic load.
paper_title: An efficient mobility management scheme for two-level HMIPv6 networks
